name: Coffee and the Cantonment
description:
It's a fun walk exploring the night life - history, hertiage, food of CantonmentYou can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.Bangalore is a cradle of the coffee culture in India. Locals and tourists both swear by it because no day is complete without a cuppa. But how did this African drink become a local favourite? What role did the British play for coffee in Bangalore? What led to the cafe culture in Bangalore? You'll find answers to all these questions on this tour.
 We will explore the history of the Cantonment, how it evolved to support the British establishment in erstwhile India, and how Bangalore went on to become a melting pot of cultures. As we do this, we will look at the evolution of coffee in the city from traditional coffee houses to new age micro-roasters catering to the needs of the ever changing city, and explore neighbourhoods that still hold stories of the British Raj.
 This tour is the perfect coffee date with the city and a must-do if you're in Bangalore or visiting.

name: Colonial Crawl
description:
It's a walk in Cubbon Park focused on the Colonial history of BangaloreWhat makes this tour specialYou can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.The Colonial Crawl is a taste of history hidden right under your noses. In this walk, we will explore how the British sahibs, memsahibs, and royalty left their mark on the garden city.
 The English influence on the sprawling Cubbon park, the origins of the Cantonment area, and the surrounding architecture are testimony to a lot of events in history. For example, the American War of Independence, the Battle of Waterloo, and the French Revolution had a connection to this region. We will spill more of this tea when you walk with us.
 Whether you are visiting or you are a local, we promise you will see the city in a different light once you learn about the colonial influence on its churches, clubs, parks, and its people.
 Cubbon mornings are a sight to sore eyes, and the perfect time to discover the Colonial Hangover in one of the older parts of the city.

name: Malleshwaram Hogona
description:
What makes this tour specialYou can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.13 Indian artists came together to create 12 walls filled with art through the secret lanes of Malleswaram to reclaim spaces for pedestrians and women. The Malleswaram Hogona (Eng: Let’s go to Malleswaram) street art project wants to make streets safer for women. Conceived by the Bengaluru moving project, this street art walk is an initiative to make neighbourhoods safe, friendly, and full of character.
 Apart from being one of the oldest planned neighbourhoods in the city, it houses a flower market, many institutions and lanes adorned with trees. Each work of art tells you the artist’s inspiration and their connection to the landscape, and we’d love to host you here.
 Let’s go to Malleswaram to witness modern day murals painted on old world lanes, starting with a legendary breakfast at CTR.

name: Yulu Midnight Trail
description:
It's a fun ride on Yulu e-bikes to explore the night life - history, hertiage, food of CantonmentWhat makes this tour specialYou can add your images, videos and itinerary route in lightbox for each itinerary as shown below, simply by changing the src path of each media.Bangalore in the night is a whole new vibe, opening up avenues of food, lights, and beautiful spots in the city that come to life as the sun sets. Welcome to Gully’s Midnight E-Bike Tour – an exclusive experience around the colonial and heritage parts of town with a late-night street food scene.
 We’ll ride together as a group in the wee hours of the night on super cool e-bikes and explore the nightlife of Bangalore beyond pubs and breweries. Think of it like a famous five adventure but cooler! Together, we will discover hidden gems in the central business district of Bangalore and paint the town green (because you know we’re responsible, eco-friendly, and fun like that).
 You will find yourself eating out at iconic eateries and street food stalls and visit places, which are otherwise closed to the public in and around Cubbon and Cantonment areas.
 We have partnered with Yulu, our mobility partners, so you can be rest assured and ride along without worrying about smaller lanes or traffic, and watch how the city comes alive at night with its night heroes who offer food, trivia, and perspectives of the midnight Uru
